citation.article-title: Stappia alba sp. nov., isolated from Mediterranean oysters

p.s: Description of Stappia alba sp. nov.
Stappia alba (al’.ba. L. fem. adj. alba white)
Gram negative, straight rods, 2–4 μm length by 1 μm width, motile by a subpolar flagellum.
They divide by binary fission and do not form rosettes.
Colonies on MA after 6 days incubation are not pigmented, opaque and mucous, indicating production of extracellular capsular material.
Oxidase and catalase positive.
Slightly halophilic, with specific requirements of Na+ and divalent cations (Ca2+ or Mg2+).
Salinity range for growth is 1–8% (w/v) total salt.
Temperature range for growth includes 13–28 °C but neither 4 nor 37 °C or above.
Chemoorganotrophic aerobe.
Fermentation or acid production from carbohydrates are absent.
In anaerobic conditions nitrate is reduced to gas.
Gelatine, casein, starch, agar, alginate and lecithin are not hydrolysed.
Medium for Tween 80 hydrolysis either does not support growth or shows no hydrolytic activity.
Strains hydrolysed DNA on DNAse medium prepared with half-strength ASW.
The following activities are negative: indole production from tryptophan, sulphide production from thiosulphate, ADH, LDC and ODC.

Able to grow with l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-mannose, d-cellobiose, sucrose, propionate, pyruvate, citrate, aconitate, 2-ketoglutarate, succinate, fumarate, malate, acetate, lactate, β-hydroxybutyrate, l-threonine, l-glutamate and γ-aminobutyrate.
Growth is weak or variable on d-glucose, d-fructose, d-raffinose, d-melibiose, d-gluconate, d-glucuronate, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, glycerate and l-alanine.

Not able to grow on d-ribose, d-galactose, d-trehalose, l-rhamnose, maltose, lactose, salicin, amygdalin, d-galacturonate, N-acetylglucosamine, glycerol, m-inositol, saccharate, glycine, l-leucine, l-serine, l-ornithine, l-aspartate, l-lysine, sarcosine or methanol.
Strains 5OM6T, 5OM9 and 5OM30 were isolated from oysters cultured at the Spanish Mediterranean coast, near Vinaroz.
They have been deposited at the CECT (Colección Española de Cultivos Tipo) under the numbers CECT 5095T, CECT 5094 and CECT 5096, respectively.
The type strain has also been deposited at CIP (Collection de l’Institut Pasteur) under the number CIP 108402T.
